meanings.definition: A term of address used to a man or boy, especially one expressing annoyance or impatience.
meanings.sent1: Sirrah, bring me my hat at once!
meanings.sent2: The old man scolded the young sirrah for his mischief.
meanings.sent3: Sirrah, stop playing pranks and help with the chores!
meanings.sent4: The teacher called out, 'Sirrah, pay attention!'
meanings.sent5: The angry farmer shouted, 'Sirrah, get off my land!'

meanings.definition: Used to address a man or boy in a commanding or authoritative manner.
meanings.sent1: Sirrah, listen to my orders and obey!
meanings.sent2: The knight commanded, 'Sirrah, fetch my sword.'
meanings.sent3: Sirrah, stand at attention and await further instructions.
meanings.sent4: The captain bellowed, 'Sirrah, prepare for battle!'
meanings.sent5: With a stern voice, the king declared, 'Sirrah, you are to be knighted.'
